   20: -module(shell_docs_markdown_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% callbacks
   23: -export([all/0, groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   24: 
   25: %% test format
   26: -export([convert_erlang_html/1, convert_unknown_format/1]).
   27: 
   28: %% test non-existing moduledoc
   29: -export([non_existing_moduledoc/1,hidden_moduledoc/1,existing_moduledoc/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% test non-existing docs
   32: -export([non_existing_doc/1, hidden_doc/1, existing_doc/1]).
   33: 
   34: %% headings
   35: -export([h1_test/1, h2_test/1, h3_test/1, h4_test/1, h5_test/1, h6_test/1,
   36:          setext_h1/1, setext_h2/1]).
   37: 
   38: %% quotes
   39: -export([single_line_quote_test/1, double_char_for_quote_test/1,
   40:          ignore_three_spaces_before_quote/1, multiple_line_quote_test/1,
   41:          paragraph_in_between_test/1, quote_with_anchor_test/1, quote_without_space/1]).
   42: 
   43: %% paragraph
   44: -export([paragraph_after_heading_test/1, quote_before_and_after_paragraph_test/1]).
   45: 
   46: %% inline code
   47: -export([single_line_code_test/1, multiple_line_code_test/1, paragraph_between_code_test/1]).
   48: 
   49: %% fence code
   50: -export([single_line_fence_code_test/1, multiple_line_fence_code_test/1,
   51:          single_line_fence_code_no_language_test/1, single_line_fence_code_no_language_spaces_test/1,
   52:          paragraph_between_fence_code_test/1, fence_code_ignores_link_format_test/1,
   53:          fence_code_with_spaces/1]).
   54: 
   55: %% br
   56: -export([start_with_br_test/1, multiple_br_followed_by_paragraph_test/1,
   57:          multiple_lines_of_a_paragraph_test/1, ending_br_test/1]).
   58: 
   59: %% Comments
   60: -export([begin_comment_test/1, after_paragraph_comment/1, forget_closing_comment/1 ]).
   61: 
   62: %% Format
   63: -export([format_heading_test/1, format_paragraph_test/1, format_multiple_inline/1,
   64:          format_multiple_inline_format_short/1, format_multiple_inline_format_long/1,
   65:          format_multiple_inline_format_mixed/1, unmatched_format_simple/1,
   66:          unmatched_format_with_inline/1, unmatched_complex_format_with_inline/1,
   67:          format_inline_link_with_inline/1, complex_inline_format/1, skip_symbols_in_inline/1,
   68:          format_header_identifier/1, italic_in_middle_word_test/1, italic_with_colons/1,
   69:          list_format_with_italics_in_sentence/1, list_format_with_bold_in_sentence/1,
   70:          new_lines_test/1, format_separator_test/1, list_with_format/1, multi_word_format_test/1,
   71:          multiline_link/1, multiline_link_not_allowed/1, inline_mfa_link/1,
   72:          escaped_character/1]).
   73: 
   74: %% Bullet lists
   75: -export([singleton_bullet_list/1, singleton_bullet_list_followed_new_paragraph/1, singleton_bullet_list_with_format/1,
   76:          singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph/1, singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph2/1,
   77:          singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph3/1, multiline_bullet_indented_list/1, multiline_bullet_indented_list2/1,
   78:          multiline_bullet_list/1, even_nested_bullet_list/1, odd_nested_bullet_list/1,
   79:          complex_nested_bullet_list/1, complex_nested_bullet_list2/1, complex_nested_bullet_list3/1,
   80:          bullet_list_mix_with_number_list/1, inline_code_list/1, bullet_list_with_anchor/1]).
   81: 
   82: %% Numbered lists
   83: -export([singleton_numbered_list/1, singleton_numbered_list_followed_new_paragraph/1,
   84:          singleton_numbered_list_with_format/1, singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph/1,
   85:          singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph2/1, multiline_numbered_indented_list/1,
   86:          multiline_numbered_indented_list2/1, multiline_numbered_list/1, even_nested_numbered_list/1,
   87:          odd_nested_numbered_list/1]).
   88: 
   89: -export([table_with_rows/1, table_with_escaped_bars/1, fake_table_test/1]).
   90: 
   91: -define(ERLANG_HTML, ~"application/erlang+html").
   92: 
   93: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   94: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   95: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   96: 
   97: 
   98: -define(EXPECTED_FUN(Expected), {{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Expected, #{}}).
   99: 
  100: all() ->
  101:     [{group, different_format_generator},
  102:      {group, module_generator},
  103:      {group, doc_generator},
  104:      {group, header_generator},
  105:      {group, quote_generator},
  106:      {group, paragraph_generator},
  107:      {group, code_generator},
  108:      {group, fence_code_generator},
  109:      {group, br_generator},
  110:      {group, comment_generator},
  111:      {group, format_generator},
  112:      {group, bullet_list_generator},
  113:      {group, numbered_list_generator},
  114:      {group, table_generator}
  115:     ].
  116: 
  117: groups() ->
  118:     [{different_format_generator, [sequence], different_format_conversion_tests()},
  119:      {module_generator, [sequence], moduledoc_tests()},
  120:      {doc_generator, [sequence], doc_tests()},
  121:      {header_generator, [sequence], header_tests()},
  122:      {quote_generator, [sequence], quote_tests()},
  123:      {paragraph_generator, [sequence], paragraph_tests()},
  124:      {code_generator, [sequence], code_tests()},
  125:      {fence_code_generator, [sequence], fence_code_tests()},
  126:      {br_generator, [sequence], br_tests()},
  127:      {comment_generator, [sequence], comment_tests()},
  128:      {format_generator, [sequence], format_tests()},
  129:      {bullet_list_generator, [sequence], bullet_list_tests()},
  130:      {numbered_list_generator, [sequence], numbered_list_tests()},
  131:      {table_generator, [sequence], table_tests()}
  132:     ].
  133: 
  134: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  135:     Config.
  136: 
  137: end_per_group(_, _Config) ->
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: different_format_conversion_tests() ->
  141:     [ convert_erlang_html,
  142:       convert_unknown_format
  143:     ].
  144: 
  145: moduledoc_tests() ->
  146:     [ non_existing_moduledoc,
  147:       hidden_moduledoc,
  148:       existing_moduledoc
  149:     ].
  150: 
  151: doc_tests() ->
  152:     [ non_existing_doc,
  153:       hidden_doc,
  154:       existing_doc
  155:     ].
  156: 
  157: header_tests() ->
  158:     [ h1_test,
  159:       h2_test,
  160:       h3_test,
  161:       h4_test,
  162:       h5_test,
  163:       h6_test,
  164:       setext_h1,
  165:       setext_h2
  166:     ].
  167: 
  168: quote_tests() ->
  169:     [ single_line_quote_test,
  170:       double_char_for_quote_test,
  171:       ignore_three_spaces_before_quote,
  172:       multiple_line_quote_test,
  173:       paragraph_in_between_test,
  174:       quote_with_anchor_test,
  175:       quote_without_space
  176:     ].
  177: 
  178: paragraph_tests() ->
  179:     [ paragraph_after_heading_test,
  180:       quote_before_and_after_paragraph_test
  181:     ].
  182: 
  183: code_tests() ->
  184:     [ single_line_code_test,
  185:       multiple_line_code_test,
  186:       paragraph_between_code_test
  187:     ].
  188: 
  189: fence_code_tests() ->
  190:   [single_line_fence_code_test,
  191:    multiple_line_fence_code_test,
  192:    single_line_fence_code_no_language_test,
  193:    single_line_fence_code_no_language_spaces_test,
  194:    paragraph_between_fence_code_test,
  195:    fence_code_ignores_link_format_test,
  196:    fence_code_with_spaces
  197:   ].
  198: 
  199: br_tests() ->
  200:     [ start_with_br_test,
  201:       multiple_br_followed_by_paragraph_test,
  202:       multiple_lines_of_a_paragraph_test,
  203:       ending_br_test
  204:     ].
  205: 
  206: comment_tests() ->
  207:     [ begin_comment_test,
  208:       after_paragraph_comment,
  209:       forget_closing_comment
  210:     ].
  211: 
  212: format_tests() ->
  213:     [ format_heading_test,
  214:       format_paragraph_test,
  215:       format_multiple_inline,
  216:       format_multiple_inline_format_long,
  217:       format_multiple_inline_format_short,
  218:       format_multiple_inline_format_mixed,
  219:       unmatched_format_simple,
  220:       unmatched_format_with_inline,
  221:       unmatched_complex_format_with_inline,
  222:       format_inline_link_with_inline,
  223:       complex_inline_format,
  224:       skip_symbols_in_inline,
  225:       format_header_identifier,
  226:       italic_in_middle_word_test,
  227:       italic_with_colons,
  228:       list_format_with_italics_in_sentence,
  229:       list_format_with_bold_in_sentence,
  230:       new_lines_test,
  231:       format_separator_test,
  232:       list_with_format,
  233:       multi_word_format_test,
  234:       multiline_link,
  235:       multiline_link_not_allowed,
  236:       inline_mfa_link,
  237:       escaped_character
  238:     ].
  239: 
  240: bullet_list_tests() ->
  241:     [ singleton_bullet_list,
  242:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_new_paragraph,
  243:       singleton_bullet_list_with_format,
  244:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph,
  245:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph2,
  246:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph3,
  247:       multiline_bullet_indented_list,
  248:       multiline_bullet_indented_list2,
  249:       multiline_bullet_list,
  250:       even_nested_bullet_list,
  251:       odd_nested_bullet_list,
  252:       complex_nested_bullet_list,
  253:       complex_nested_bullet_list2,
  254:       complex_nested_bullet_list3,
  255:       bullet_list_mix_with_number_list,
  256:       inline_code_list,
  257:       bullet_list_with_anchor
  258:     ].
  259: 
  260: numbered_list_tests() ->
  261:     [ singleton_numbered_list,
  262:       singleton_numbered_list_followed_new_paragraph,
  263:       singleton_numbered_list_with_format,
  264:       singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph,
  265:       singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph2,
  266:       multiline_numbered_indented_list,
  267:       multiline_numbered_indented_list2,
  268:       multiline_numbered_list,
  269:       even_nested_numbered_list,
  270:       odd_nested_numbered_list
  271:     ].
  272: 
  273: table_tests() ->
  274:   [ table_with_rows,
  275:     table_with_escaped_bars,
  276:     fake_table_test].
  277: 
  278: convert_erlang_html(_Conf) ->
  279:     Doc = #{~"en" => [{p, [], [~"Test"]}]},
  280:     Functions = [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Doc, #{}}],
  281: 
  282:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ?ERLANG_HTML, none, #{}, Functions),
  283:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  284:     ok.
  285: 
  286: convert_unknown_format(_Conf) ->
  287:     Doc = #{~"en" => ~"<text>Here</text>"},
  288:     Functions = create_fun(Doc),
  289: 
  290:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"xml", Doc, #{},Functions),
  291:     ok = try
  292:            shell_docs:validate(Docs)
  293:          catch
  294:            error:function_clause ->
  295:              ok
  296:          end,
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: non_existing_moduledoc(_Conf) ->
  300:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", none, #{}, []),
  301:     _ = compile(Docs),
  302:     ok.
  303: 
  304: hidden_moduledoc(_Conf) ->
  305:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", hidden, #{}, []),
  306:     _ = compile(Docs),
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: existing_moduledoc(_Conf) ->
  310:     Docs = create_eep48_doc(~"# Here"),
  311:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
  312:     #{~"en" := HtmlModDoc} = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
  313:     H1 = header(1, ~"Here"),
  314:     [H1] = HtmlModDoc,
  315:     ok.
  316: 
  317: non_existing_doc(_Conf) ->
  318:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", none, #{}, create_fun(none)),
  319:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  320:     ok.
  321: 
  322: hidden_doc(_Conf) ->
  323:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", none, #{}, create_fun(hidden)),
  324:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  325:     ok.
  326: 
  327: existing_doc(_Conf) ->
  328:     Docs = create_eep48_doc(~"Test"),
  329:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: h1_test(_Conf) ->
  333:     Input = ~"# Here",
  334:     Result = [header(1, ~"Here")],
  335:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  336: 
  337: h2_test(_Conf) ->
  338:     Input = ~"# Here\n## Header 2",
  339:     Result = [header(1, ~"Here"), header(2,~"Header 2")],
  340:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  341: 
  342: h3_test(_Conf) ->
  343:     Input = ~"# Here\n### Header 3",
  344:     Result = [header(1, ~"Here"), header(3, ~"Header 3")],
  345:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  346: 
  347: h4_test(_Conf) ->
  348:     Input = ~"### Here\n#### Header 4",
  349:     Result = [header(3, ~"Here"), header(4, ~"Header 4")],
  350:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  351: 
  352: h5_test(_Conf) ->
  353:     Convert = fun shell_docs_markdown:parse_md/1,
  354:     Doc = #{~"en" => Convert(~"### Here\n#### Header 4\n##### H5")},
  355:     DocH5 = #{~"en" => Convert(~"##### H5")},
  356:     Functions = [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Doc, #{}},
  357:                  {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], DocH5, #{}}],
  358:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", Doc, #{}, Functions),
  359: 
  360:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
  361:     ExpectedH3 = #{~"en" => [ header(3, ~"Here"),
  362:                               header(4, ~"Header 4"),
  363:                               header(5, ~"H5")]},
  364:     ExpectedH5 = #{~"en" => [ header(5, ~"H5") ]},
  365:     ExpectedH3 = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
  366:     [ E1, E2 ] = extract_doc(HtmlDocs),
  367:     {{function, foo, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH3, #{}} = E1,
  368:     {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH5, #{}} = E2,
  369:     ok.
  370: 
  371: h6_test(_Conf) ->
  372:     Convert = fun shell_docs_markdown:parse_md/1,
  373:     Doc = #{~"en" => Convert(~"### Here\n#### Header 4\n##### H5")},
  374:     DocH6 = #{~"en" => Convert(~"###### H6\n## H2")},
  375:     Functions = [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Doc, #{}},
  376:                  {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], DocH6, #{}}],
  377:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", Doc, #{}, Functions),
  378: 
  379:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
  380:     ExpectedH3 = #{~"en" => [ header(3, ~"Here"),
  381:                               header(4, ~"Header 4"),
  382:                               header(5, ~"H5")]},
  383:     ExpectedH6 = #{~"en" => [ header(6, ~"H6"),
  384:                               header(2, ~"H2")]},
  385:     ExpectedH3 = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
  386:     [ E1, E2 ] = extract_doc(HtmlDocs),
  387:     {{function, foo, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH3, #{}} = E1,
  388:     {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH6, #{}} = E2,
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: setext_h1(_Config) ->
  392:     Input = ~"Here\n===\n\nNew text",
  393:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  394:                p(~"New text")],
  395:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  396: 
  397: setext_h2(_Config) ->
  398:     Input = ~"Here\n--\n\nNew text",
  399:     Result = [ header(2, ~"Here"),
  400:                p(~"New text")],
  401:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  402: 
  403: single_line_quote_test(_Conf) ->
  404:     Input = ~"# Here\n> This is a quote",
  405:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  406:                blockquote(p(~"This is a quote"))],
  407:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  408: 
  409: double_char_for_quote_test(_Conf) ->
  410:     Input = ~"# Here\n>> This is a quote",
  411:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  412:                blockquote(p(~"This is a quote"))],
  413:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  414: 
  415: ignore_three_spaces_before_quote(_Conf) ->
  416:     Input = ~"   > # Here",
  417:     Result = blockquote([header(1, ~"Here")]),
  418:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  419: 
  420: multiple_line_quote_test(_Conf) ->
  421:     Input = ~"> # Here\n> This is a quote",
  422:     Result = [ blockquote([header(1, ~"Here"),
  423:                            p(~"This is a quote")])],
  424:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  425: 
  426: paragraph_in_between_test(_Conf) ->
  427:     Input = ~"# Header 1\nThis is text\n> A quote\n> continues\n## Header 2\nBody content",
  428:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Header 1"),
  429:                p(~"This is text"),
  430:                blockquote([p(~"A quote continues")]),
  431:                header(2, ~"Header 2"),
  432:                p(~"Body content")],
  433:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  434: 
  435: quote_with_anchor_test(_Config) ->
  436:     Input =
  437: ~"> #### Note{: .info }
  438: >
  439: > The [User's Guide](index.html) has examples and a
  440: > [Getting Started](using_ssh.md) section.",
  441:     Result = [blockquote([header(4,~"Note"),
  442:                                      p([~"The User's Guide has examples and a Getting Started section."])])],
  443:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  444: 
  445: quote_without_space(_Config) ->
  446:     Input =
  447: ~"> #### Note{: .info }
  448: >
  449: >The [User's Guide](index.html) has examples and a
  450: > [Getting Started](using_ssh.md) section.",
  451:     Result = [blockquote([header(4,~"Note"),
  452:                                      p([~"The User's Guide has examples and a Getting Started section."])])],
  453:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  454: 
  455: paragraph_after_heading_test(_Conf) ->
  456:     Input = ~"# Header 1\nThis is text\n\nBody content",
  457:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Header 1"),
  458:                p(~"This is text"),
  459:                p(~"Body content")],
  460:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  461: 
  462: quote_before_and_after_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  463:     Input = ~"> Quote 1\nThis is text\n> Quote 2\nBody content",
  464:     Result = [ blockquote(p(~"Quote 1")),
  465:                p(~"This is text"),
  466:                blockquote(p(~"Quote 2")),
  467:                p(~"Body content")],
  468:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  469: 
  470: single_line_code_test(_Conf) ->
  471:     Input = ~"# Here\n    This is code",
  472:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  473:                code(~"This is code\n")],
  474:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  475: 
  476: multiple_line_code_test(_Conf) ->
  477:     Input = ~"    # Here\n    This is code\n        Nested Line",
  478:     Result = code(~"# Here\nThis is code\n    Nested Line\n"),
  479:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  480: 
  481: paragraph_between_code_test(_Conf) ->
  482:     Input = <<"This is a paragraph\n",
  483:               "\n",
  484:               "    # Here\n",
  485:               "    This is code\n",
  486:               "        Nested Line\n",
  487:               "Another paragraph">>,
  488:     Result = [ p(~"This is a paragraph"),
  489:                code(~"# Here\nThis is code\n    Nested Line\n"),
  490:                p(~"Another paragraph")],
  491:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  492: 
  493: single_line_fence_code_test(_Conf) ->
  494:     Input = ~"
  495: ```erlang
  496: test() -> ok.
  497: ```",
  498:     Result = [ code(~"test() -> ok.\n", [{class, ~"language-erlang"}])],
  499:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  500: 
  501: multiple_line_fence_code_test(_Conf) ->
  502:     Input = ~"
  503: ```erlang
  504: test() ->
  505:   ok.
  506: ```",
  507:     Result = [ code(~"test() ->\n  ok.\n", [{class, ~"language-erlang"}])],
  508:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  509: 
  510: single_line_fence_code_no_language_test(_Conf) ->
  511:     Input = ~"
  512: ```
  513: test() -> ok.
  514: ```",
  515:     Result = [ code(~"test() -> ok.\n")],
  516:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  517: 
  518: single_line_fence_code_no_language_spaces_test(_Conf) ->
  519:     Input = ~"
  520: ```\s\s
  521: test() -> ok.
  522: ```",
  523:     Result = [ code(~"test() -> ok.\n")],
  524:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  525: 
  526: paragraph_between_fence_code_test(_Conf) ->
  527:     Input = ~"This is a test:
  528: ```erlang
  529: test() ->
  530:   ok.
  531: ```",
  532:     Result = [p(~"This is a test:"),
  533:                          code(~"test() ->\n  ok.\n", [{class, ~"language-erlang"}])],
  534:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  535: 
  536: fence_code_ignores_link_format_test(_Conf) ->
  537:     Input = ~"This is a test:
  538: ```erlang
  539: [foo](bar)
  540: ```",
  541:     Result = [p(~"This is a test:"),
  542:               code(~"[foo](bar)\n", [{class, ~"language-erlang"}])],
  543:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  544: 
  545: fence_code_with_spaces(_Config) ->
  546:     Input =
  547: ~"  ```erlang\s\s
  548:   [foo](bar)
  549: ```",
  550:     Result = [code(~"  [foo](bar)\n", [{class, ~"language-erlang"}])],
  551:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  552: 
  553: start_with_br_test(_Conf) ->
  554:     Input = ~"\n\nAnother paragraph",
  555:     Result = [ p(~"Another paragraph")],
  556:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  557: 
  558: multiple_br_followed_by_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  559:     Input = ~"\nAnother paragraph\n\nAnother paragraph",
  560:     Result = [ p(~"Another paragraph"),
  561:                p(~"Another paragraph")],
  562:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  563: 
  564: multiple_lines_of_a_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  565:   Input = ~"""
  566: Returns a new list `List3`, which is made from the elements of `List1` followed
  567: by the elements of `List2`.
  568: """,
  569:     Result = [p([~"Returns a new list ",
  570:                  inline_code(~"List3"),
  571:                  ~", which is made from the elements of ",
  572:                  inline_code(~"List1"), ~" followed by the elements of ",
  573:                  inline_code(~"List2"), ~"."])],
  574:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  575: 
  576: ending_br_test(_Conf) ->
  577:     Input = ~"Test\n",
  578:     Result = [ p(~"Test")],
  579:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  580: 
  581: begin_comment_test(_Conf) ->
  582:     Input = ~"<!-- Ignore -->Test",
  583:     Result = [ p(~"Test")],
  584:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  585: 
  586: after_paragraph_comment(_Conf) ->
  587:     Input = ~"Test\n<!-- Ignore -->Test",
  588:     Result = [ p(~"Test"), p(~"Test")],
  589:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  590: 
  591: forget_closing_comment(_Conf) ->
  592:     ok = try
  593:            create_eep48_doc(~"Test\n<!-- Ignore Test")
  594:          catch
  595:            error:missing_close_comment ->
  596:              ok
  597:          end,
  598:     ok.
  599: 
  600: format_heading_test(_Conf) ->
  601:     Input = ~"# **H1**\n## _H2_\n### `H3`",
  602:     Result = [ header(1, em(~"H1")),
  603:                header(2, it(~"H2")),
  604:                header(3, inline_code(~"H3"))
  605:              ],
  606:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  607: 
  608: format_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  609:     Input = ~"**H1** *HH* _H2_ __H3__ `code`",
  610:     Result = [ p([ em(~"H1"),
  611:                    ~" ",
  612:                    it(~"HH"),
  613:                    ~" ",
  614:                    it(~"H2"),
  615:                    ~" ",
  616:                    em(~"H3"),
  617:                    ~" ",
  618:                    inline_code(~"code")
  619:                  ])
  620:              ],
  621:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  622: 
  623: format_multiple_inline(_Conf) ->
  624:     Input = ~"**H1 *HH***",
  625:     Result = [ p([ em([~"H1 ", it(~"HH")])]) ],
  626:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  627: 
  628: format_multiple_inline_format_long(_Conf) ->
  629:     Input = ~"**H1 __HH__**",
  630:     Result = [ p([ em([~"H1 ", em(~"HH")])]) ],
  631:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  632: 
  633: format_multiple_inline_format_short(_Conf) ->
  634:     Input = ~"_H1 *HH*_",
  635:     Result = [ p([ it([~"H1 ", it(~"HH")])])],
  636:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  637: 
  638: format_multiple_inline_format_mixed(_Conf) ->
  639:     Input = ~"__H1 *HH* _test_ **test2**__ _there_",
  640:     Result = [ p([ em([~"H1 ", it(~"HH"), ~" ", it(~"test"), ~" ", em(~"test2")]),
  641:                    ~" ",
  642:                    it(~"there")])
  643:              ],
  644:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  645: 
  646: unmatched_format_simple(_Conf) ->
  647:     Input = ~"**Bold*",
  648:     Result = [ p([~"**Bold*" ])],
  649:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  650: 
  651: unmatched_format_with_inline(_Conf) ->
  652:     Input = ~"**Bold *Italics*",
  653:     Result = p([~"**Bold ", it(~"Italics") ]),
  654:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  655: 
  656: unmatched_complex_format_with_inline(_Conf) ->
  657:     Input = ~"__H1 *HH* _test_ **test2** _there_ ",
  658:     Result = [ p([ ~"__H1 ", it(~"HH"), ~" ", it(~"test"), ~" ",
  659:                    em(~"test2"),
  660:                    ~" ",
  661:                    it(~"there"), ~" "])
  662:              ],
  663:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  664: 
  665: format_inline_link_with_inline(_Config) ->
  666:     Input = ~"[`splitwith/2`](`splitwith/2`) behaves as if",
  667:     Result = [ p([inline_code(~"splitwith/2"),~" behaves as if"])],
  668:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  669: 
  670: complex_inline_format(_Config) ->
  671:   %% The complexity here comes from the _, where the alg needs to backtrack
  672:   %% add the _ to an existing buffer, and continue where it left off using  %% any previous opening format characters, in this case **.
  673:   Input = ~"**`{set_alarm, {AlarmId, AlarmDescr}}`**",
  674:   Result = p(em(inline_code(~"{set_alarm, {AlarmId, AlarmDescr}}"))),
  675:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  676: 
  677: italic_in_middle_word_test(_Config) ->
  678:   Input = ~"this ssh_daemon_channel is not in italics",
  679:   Result = p(~"this ssh_daemon_channel is not in italics"),
  680:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  681: 
  682: italic_with_colons(_Config) ->
  683:   Input = ~"_This is ok:_ **test:**",
  684:   Result = p([it(~"This is ok:"), ~" ", em(~"test:")]),
  685:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  686: 
  687: list_format_with_italics_in_sentence(_Config) ->
  688:   Input = ~"- Mandatory: one or more _Host key(s)_. Default is `/etc/ssh`",
  689:   Result = ul([li(p([~"Mandatory: one or more ",
  690:                      it(~"Host key(s)"),
  691:                      ~". Default is ",
  692:                      inline_code(~"/etc/ssh")]))]),
  693:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  694: 
  695: list_format_with_bold_in_sentence(_Config) ->
  696:   Input = ~"- Mandatory: one or more __Host key(s)__. Default is `/etc/ssh`",
  697:   Result = ul([li(p([~"Mandatory: one or more ",
  698:                      em(~"Host key(s)"),
  699:                      ~". Default is ",
  700:                      inline_code(~"/etc/ssh")]))]),
  701:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  702: 
  703: format_separator_test(_Config) ->
  704:   Input = ~"**This is a Test,**, including _a parens)_ and **This is a Test**, end",
  705:   Result = p([em(~"This is a Test,"),
  706:               ~", including ",
  707:               it(~"a parens)"),
  708:               ~" and ",
  709:               em(~"This is a Test"),
  710:               ~", end"
  711:              ]),
  712:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  713: 
  714: multi_word_format_test(_Config) ->
  715:   Input = ~"**`--help` (or `-h`)** - Print this message and exit.",
  716:   Result = p([em([inline_code(~"--help"),
  717:                   ~" (or ",
  718:                   inline_code(~"-h"),
  719:                   ~")"]),
  720:               ~" - Print this message and exit."]),
  721:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  722: 
  723: 
  724: multiline_link(_Config) ->
  725:   Input = ~"this is a [link with\nnew line](erlang.com)",
  726:   Result = p([~"this is a link with new line"]),
  727:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  728: 
  729: %% As per commonmark.js-0.28.1, Github Flavoured Markdown 0.23.10
  730: multiline_link_not_allowed(_Config) ->
  731:   Input = ~"this is a [link with new line]\n(erlang.com)",
  732:   Result = p([~"this is a [link with new line] (erlang.com)"]),
  733:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  734: 
  735: inline_mfa_link(_Config) ->
  736:   Input = ~"See `t:count()`, and `c:arith:plus/1`, `e:math:sum/2`, and `m:extra:here/1`",
  737:   Result = p([~"See ", inline_code(~"count()"), ~", and ",
  738:               inline_code(~"arith:plus/1"), ~", ",
  739:               inline_code(~"math:sum/2"), ~", and ",
  740:               inline_code(~"extra:here/1")]),
  741:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  742: 
  743: escaped_character(_Config) ->
  744:   Input = ~B"Here \*not bold\* and \`not code\` and \_means_nothing_ `\`test\``",
  745:   Result = p([~"Here *not bold* and `not code` and _means_nothing_ ",
  746:               inline_code(~"`test`")]),
  747:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  748: 
  749: list_with_format(_Config) ->
  750:   Input = ~"- **`--help` (or `-h`)** - Print this message and exit.",
  751:   Result = ul([li(p([em([inline_code(~"--help"),
  752:                          ~" (or ",
  753:                          inline_code(~"-h"),
  754:                          ~")"]),
  755:                      ~" - Print this message and exit."]))]),
  756:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  757: 
  758: new_lines_test(_Config) ->
  759:   Input = ~"Render in
  760: the same line",
  761:   Result = p([~"Render in the same line"]),
  762:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  763: 
  764: skip_symbols_in_inline(_Config) ->
  765:   Input = ~"**`{the_beginning, the_end}`**",
  766:   Result = p(em(inline_code(~"{the_beginning, the_end}"))),
  767:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  768: 
  769: format_header_identifier(_Config) ->
  770:   Input = ~"## Test {: #id .class} there",
  771:   Result = header(2, ~"Test  there"),
  772:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).

  774: singleton_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  775:     Input = ~"* One liner",
  776:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner"))])],
  777:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  778: 
  779: singleton_bullet_list_followed_new_paragraph(_Config) ->
  780:     Input = ~"* One liner\n\nThis is a new paragraph",
  781:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner"))]), p(~"This is a new paragraph")],
  782:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  783: 
  784: singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph(_Config) ->
  785:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  This is a new paragraph",
  786:     Result = [ul([li([p([~"One liner This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  787:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  788: 
  789: singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph2(_Config) ->
  790:     Input = ~"* One liner.\nThis is a new paragraph",
  791:     Result = [ul([li([p([~"One liner. This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  792:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  793: 
  794: singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph3(_Config) ->
  795:     Input = ~"* One liner\n\n  This is a new paragraph\n  continue here\n\n  and this one follows\n\nNew text",
  796:     Result = [ul([li([p(~"One liner"),
  797:                       p([~"This is a new paragraph continue here"]),
  798:                       p(~"and this one follows")])]),
  799:               p(~"New text")],
  800:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  801: 
  802: singleton_bullet_list_with_format(_Config) ->
  803:     Input = ~"* *One* __liner__",
  804:     Result = [ul([li(p([it(~"One"), ~" ",  em(~"liner")]))])],
  805:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  806: 
  807: multiline_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  808:     Input = ~"* One liner\n* Second line",
  809:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  810:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  811: 
  812: multiline_bullet_indented_list(_Config) ->
  813:     Input = ~"  * One liner\n  * Second line",
  814:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  815:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  816: 
  817: multiline_bullet_indented_list2(_Config) ->
  818:     Input = ~"  * _One liner_\n  * _Second_ `line`",
  819:     Result = [ul([li(p(it(~"One liner"))),
  820:                   li(p([it(~"Second"), ~" ",  inline_code(~"line")]))])],
  821:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  822: 
  823: even_nested_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  824:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  * First nested line\n  * Second nested line",
  825:     Result = [ul([
  826:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  827:                        ul([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  828:                             li(p(~"Second nested line"))
  829:                           ])
  830:                      ])
  831:                  ])],
  832:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  833: 
  834: odd_nested_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  835:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  * First nested line\n  * Second nested line\n  * Third nested line",
  836:     Result = [ul([
  837:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  838:                        ul([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  839:                             li(p(~"Second nested line")),
  840:                             li(p(~"Third nested line"))
  841:                           ])
  842:                      ])
  843:                  ])],
  844:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  845: 
  846: complex_nested_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  847:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  * First nested line\n* Second line",
  848:     Result = [ul([
  849:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  850:                        ul([ li(p(~"First nested line")) ])
  851:                      ]),
  852:                   li([p(~"Second line")])
  853:                  ])],
  854:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  855: 
  856: complex_nested_bullet_list2(_Config) ->
  857:     Input = ~"
  858: * One liner
  859:   * First nested line
  860:     * Second level nested line
  861:   * Second nested line
  862:     * Another nested line
  863: * Second one liner",
  864:     Result = [ul([
  865:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  866:                        ul([ li([
  867:                                 p(~"First nested line"),
  868:                                 ul([ li([p(~"Second level nested line")])])
  869:                                ]),
  870:                             li([
  871:                                 p(~"Second nested line"),
  872:                                 ul([ li([p(~"Another nested line")])])
  873:                                ])
  874:                           ])
  875:                      ]),
  876:                   li([ p(~"Second one liner")])
  877:                  ])],
  878:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  879: 
  880: complex_nested_bullet_list3(_Config) ->
  881:     Input = ~"
  882: - Optional: one or more _User's private key(s)_ in case of `publickey`
  883:   authorization. The default files are
  884:   - `id_dsa` and `id_dsa.pub`
  885:   - `id_rsa` and `id_rsa.pub`
  886:   - `id_ecdsa` and `id_ecdsa.pub`
  887: ",
  888:     Result = [ul([ li([p([~"Optional: one or more ",
  889:                           it(~"User's private key(s)"),
  890:                           ~" in case of ",
  891:                           inline_code(~"publickey"),
  892:                            ~" authorization. The default files are"]),
  893:                       ul([ li( [p([inline_code(~"id_dsa"),
  894:                                 ~" and ",
  895:                                 inline_code(~"id_dsa.pub")])]),
  896:                            li( [p([inline_code(~"id_rsa"),
  897:                                   ~" and ",
  898:                                   inline_code(~"id_rsa.pub")])]),
  899:                            li( [p([inline_code(~"id_ecdsa"),
  900:                                 ~" and ",
  901:                                inline_code(~"id_ecdsa.pub")])])])])])],
  902:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  903: 
  904: bullet_list_mix_with_number_list(_Config) ->
  905:     Input = ~"* Bullet list\n1. Numbered list",
  906:     Result = [ul([li([ p(~"Bullet list")])]),
  907:               ol([li([ p(~"Numbered list")])])],
  908:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  909: 
  910: inline_code_list(_Config) ->
  911:     Input = ~"""
  912: * ```
  913:   Code block
  914:     More code
  915:   ```
  916:   {: .class }
  917: """,
  918:     Result = [ul([li([ code(~"Code block\n  More code\n")])])],
  919:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  920: 
  921: %% this example could render the last line within the inner ul.
  922: %% the end result looks exactly the same, and the fix is non-trivial.
  923: bullet_list_with_anchor(_Config) ->
  924:     Input = ~"""
  925: - **`+c true | false`**{: #+c } - Enables or disables
  926:   [time correction](time_correction.md#time-correction):
  927: 
  928:   - **`true`** - Enables time correction.
  929:   - another example
  930: 
  931:   - **`false`** - Disables time correction.
  932: """,
  933:     Result = [ul([li([ p([em(inline_code(~"+c true | false")),
  934:                           ~" - Enables or disables time correction:"]),
  935:                        ul([li([ p([ em(inline_code(~"true")), ~" - Enables time correction."])]),
  936:                            li([ p(~"another example")])]),
  937:                        ul([li(p([ em(inline_code(~"false")), ~" - Disables time correction."]))])])])],
  938:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  939: 
  940: singleton_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  941:     Input = ~"1. One liner",
  942:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner"))])],
  943:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  944: 
  945: singleton_numbered_list_followed_new_paragraph(_Config) ->
  946:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n\nThis is a new paragraph",
  947:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner"))]), p(~"This is a new paragraph")],
  948:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  949: 
  950: singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph(_Config) ->

  953:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  954: 
  955: singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph2(_Config) ->

  957:     Result = [ol([li([p([~"One liner. This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  958:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  959: 
  960: singleton_numbered_list_with_format(_Config) ->
  961:     Input = ~"1. *One* __liner__",

  963:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  964: 
  965: multiline_numbered_indented_list(_Config) ->

  968:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  969: 
  970: multiline_numbered_indented_list2(_Config) ->
  971:     Input = ~"  1. _One liner_\n  2. _Second_ `line`",
  972:     Result = [ol([li(p(it(~"One liner"))),
  973:                   li(p([it(~"Second"), ~" ",  inline_code(~"line")]))])],

  975: 
  976: multiline_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  977:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n2. Second line",
  978:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  979:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  980: 
  981: even_nested_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  982:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n  1. First nested line\n  2. Second nested line",
  983:     Result = [ol([
  984:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  985:                        ol([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  986:                             li(p(~"Second nested line"))
  987:                           ])
  988:                      ])
  989:                  ])],

  991: 
  992: odd_nested_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  993:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n  1. First nested line\n  2. Second nested line\n  3. Third nested line",
  994:     Result = [ol([
  995:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  996:                        ol([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  997:                             li(p(~"Second nested line")),
  998:                             li(p(~"Third nested line"))
  999:                           ])
 1000:                      ])
 1001:                  ])],
 1002:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).

 1004: 
 1005: table_with_rows(_Config) ->
 1006:     Input = ~"""
 1007: | H1 | H2 | H3 |
 1008: |:-----|:--:|----|
 1009: |D1   | D2 | D3 |
 1010: """,
 1011:     Result = table([~"| H1 | H2 | H3 |\n",
 1012:                                 ~"|:-----|:--:|----|\n",
 1013:                                 ~"|D1   | D2 | D3 |\n"]),
 1014:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
 1015: 
 1016: table_with_escaped_bars(_Config) ->
 1017:     Input = ~"""
 1018: | **JSON** | **Erlang**             |
 1019: |----------|------------------------|
 1020: | Number   | `integer() \| float()` |
 1021: """,
 1022:     Result = table([~"| **JSON** | **Erlang**             |\n",
 1023:                     ~"|----------|------------------------|\n",
 1024:                     ~"| Number   | `integer() \\| float()` |\n"]),
 1025:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
 1026: 
 1027: fake_table_test(_Config) ->
 1028:     NotTable = ~"""
 1029: | **JSON** | **Erlang**
 1030: """,
 1031:     Result = [p([~"| ", em(~"JSON"), ~" | ", em(~"Erlang")])],
 1032:     compile_and_compare(NotTable, Result).
 1033: 
 1034: header(Level, Text) when is_integer(Level) ->
 1035:     HeadingLevel = integer_to_list(Level),
 1036:     HeadingLevelAtom = list_to_existing_atom("h" ++ HeadingLevel),
 1037:     {HeadingLevelAtom, [], [Text]}.
 1038: 
 1039: code(X) ->
 1040:     code(X, []).
 1041: code(X, Attrs) when is_list(X) ->
 1042:     {pre,[],[{code,Attrs,X}]};
 1043: code(X, Attrs) ->
 1044:     {pre,[],[{code,Attrs,[X]}]}.
 1045: 
 1046: table(Table) when is_list(Table) ->
 1047:     {pre,[], [{code, [{class, ~"table"}], Table}]}.
 1048: 
 1049: inline_code(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1050:     {code,[],X};
 1051: inline_code(X) ->
 1052:     {code,[],[X]}.
 1053: 
 1054: p(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1055:     {p, [], X};
 1056: p(X) when is_tuple(X); is_binary(X) ->
 1057:     p([X]).
 1058: 
 1059: blockquote(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1060:   {blockquote, [], X};
 1061: blockquote(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
 1062:     {blockquote, [], [Tuple]}.
 1063: 
 1064: em(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1065:     {em, [], X};
 1066: em(X) when is_binary(X); is_tuple(X) ->
 1067:     em([X]).
 1068: 
 1069: it(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1070:     {i, [], X};
 1071: it(X) when is_binary(X); is_tuple(X) ->
 1072:     it([X]).
 1073: 
 1074: ul(Items) when is_list(Items) ->
 1075:     {ul, [], Items}.
 1076: 
 1077: ol(Items) when is_list(Items) ->
 1078:     {ol, [], Items}.
 1079: 
 1080: li(Item) when is_tuple(Item); is_binary(Item) ->
 1081:     li([Item]);
 1082: li(Items) when is_list(Items) ->
 1083:     {li, [], Items}.
 1084: 
 1085: -spec create_eep48(Language, Mime, ModuleDoc, Metadata, Docs) -> #docs_v1{} when
 1086:       Language  :: atom(),
 1087:       Mime      :: binary(),
 1088:       ModuleDoc :: #{DocLanguage := DocValue} | none | hidden,
 1089:       Metadata  :: map(),
 1090:       Docs      :: [{{Kind, Name, Arity},
 1091:                      Anno :: erl_anno:anno(),
 1092:                      Signature :: [binary()],
 1093:                      Doc :: #{DocLanguage := DocValue} | none | hidden,
 1094:                      Metadata :: map()
 1095:                     }],
 1096:       Kind      :: function | type | callback,
 1097:       Name      :: atom(),
 1098:       Arity     :: non_neg_integer(),
 1099:       DocLanguage :: binary(),
 1100:       DocValue :: binary() | term().
 1101: create_eep48(Language, Mime, ModuleDoc, Metadata, Docs) ->
 1102:     #docs_v1{anno = [],
 1103:              beam_language = Language,
 1104:              format = Mime,
 1105:              module_doc = ModuleDoc,
 1106:              metadata = maps:merge(#{ otp_doc_vsn => ?CURR_DOC_VERSION }, Metadata),
 1107:              docs = Docs}.
 1108: 
 1109: extract_moduledoc(Docs) ->
 1110:     Docs#docs_v1.module_doc.
 1111: 
 1112: extract_doc(Docs) ->
 1113:     Docs#docs_v1.docs.
 1114: 
 1115: extract_format(Docs) ->
 1116:     Docs#docs_v1.format.
 1117: 
 1118: create_eep48_doc(Doc) when is_binary(Doc) ->
 1119:     create_eep48_doc(Doc, ~"application/erlang+html").
 1120: 
 1121: create_eep48_doc(Doc, Format) when is_binary(Doc) ->
 1122:     Docs = #{~"en" => shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(Doc)},
 1123:     create_eep48(erlang, Format, Docs, #{}, create_fun(Docs)).
 1124: 
 1125: create_fun(Docs) ->
 1126:     [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Docs, #{}}].
 1127: 
 1128: expected(X) when is_list(X)->
 1129:     #{~"en" => X};
 1130: expected(X) when is_tuple(X) ->
 1131:     expected([X]).
 1132: 
 1133: compile(Docs) ->
 1134:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
 1135:     ?NATIVE_FORMAT = extract_format(Docs),
 1136:     Docs.
 1137: 
 1138: compile_and_compare(Input, Result) ->
 1139:     Docs = create_eep48_doc(Input),
 1140:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
 1141: 
 1142:     Expected = expected(Result),
 1143:     Expected = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
 1144:     [ ?EXPECTED_FUN(Expected) ] = extract_doc(HtmlDocs),
 1145:     ok.
